lines.gurmukhi: kMcn kls jYsy bwko Bey sUDo hoie mwtI ko klsu PUto jurY n jqn sY
lines.transliteration_english: Kanchan Kalas Jaisay Baako Bhaay Soodho Hoi , Maatee Ko Kalasu Dhooto Jurai N Jatan Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a golden pitcher if dented can be set right whereas an earthenware pitcher can never be restored to its original shape when broken.

lines.gurmukhi: bsn mlIn Doey inrml hoq jYsy aUjrI n hoq kwNbrI pqn sY
lines.transliteration_english: Basan Maleen Dhoay Niramal Hot Jaisay , Oojaree N Hot Kaanbaree Patan Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a dirty cloth can be made clean by washing, whereas a black blanket can never become white till reduced to tatters.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy lkutI Agin sykq hI sUDI hoie s√çwn pUiC ptMqro pRgt mn qn sY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Lakoutee Agani Saykat Hee Soodhee Hoi , Svaan Poochhi Patantaro Pragat Man Tan Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wooden stick when heated on fire can be straightened, but a dog's tail can never be straightened despite numerous efforts.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurisKn suBwau jl mY n giq swkq suBwv lwK pwhun gqn sY ]390]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gursikhan Soubhaau Jal Mai N Gati , Saakat Soubhaav Laakh Paahoun Gatan Sai ?390?

Shabad OS B.translation: So is the nature of True Guru-oriented obedient Sikhs who are tender and malleable like water and wax. On the other hand, the temperament of mammon-loving person is rigid and hard like shellac and stone and thus is destructive.  (390)
